summary: I am proven leader, who works very well in both a structured / regimented environment as well as in a solo capacity. Even as a Project Manager, I retain the ability to remain focused to the “Team Oriented” concept. I am a proven problem solver and I think very well under pressure. Due to my diversity, I possess very strong communication skills, both direct and interpersonal. I have the ability to travel as needed, fitting well into any environment. I understand the difference between Supervision and Management, always leading by example. 27 years of Military experience, both Active Duty as well as Reserve. Career emphasis most recently, has been holding a direct leadership position, serving as the Chief Instructor for the Florida Counterdrug Program, Law Enforcement Training Mission, mentoring junior level instructors, providing quality control on classes, developing new curriculum and providing cutting edge tactical training to Local, State and Federal Law Enforcement Agencies. Currently sworn as a certified Law Enforcement Officer in the State of Florida, serving as the departmental Lead Training Officer, in a part-time capacity. I have served in the past as a Criminal Intelligence Analyst for the Florida Counterdrug Program, and have extensive experience in Counter Threat Financing, Narco-Terrorism Threat Analysis and multiple disciplines within this arena. Proven communicator, proven leader under stress. Military experience centered around the Tactical Signal Intelligence (SIGINT) arena assigned to US Army Special Operations as a Special Operations Team - Alpha (SOT-A) Team Member / Team Sergeant, progressing to Tactical Human Intelligence (HUMINT) / Source Operations. Multiple deployments in both theaters of operations, as well as other areas of interest, working daily in chosen Military Occupational Specialty (MOS).

summary: SERVICE INTELLIGENCE ADVANCED GROUP Staffed by personnel of elite military, security and civil backgrounds.Service Intelligence Advanced Group Officers conduct intelligence operations under tactical and non-tactical conditions in multiple environments; detect, monitor and exploit threat communications through communications transmission intercept and direction finding; and collect positive intelligence information against local terrorists, insurgents, activists, criminal organizations and personnel, and other hostile elements and activities that may pose a threat to United States interests. In addition to their linguistic, international Morse code (IMC), HUMINT and SIGINT skills; we are trained in tactical and field-craft techniques and are certified in advanced military skills. “Certified Fraud Examiner” (CFE), a Certified Security Consultant (CSC) from the International Institute Of Security & Safety Management, IISSM, a “Certified Fraud Consultant” (CFC) from the International Fraud Training Institute a “Fellow” (FACFE) & “Diplomat” (DABFE) of The American College of Forensic Examiners. and certification in “Homeland Security” Level III – CHSIII. Our purpose is to offer governments and other legitimate organizations specialist military expertise an provide active support to friendly governments & to support them in conflict resolution, has materially decreased,s has their capability to do so. Securing strategic assets –water,food,electricity key installations,Convoy escort Air support,Marine support we can assist in non conflict support to law and order, typical areas include, but are not restricted to Counter -narcotics/Counter- terrorism Protection of key installations Revenue/Fisheries protection/maritime surveillance Operations support we can provide specialist in Command,control communication teams Special forces/Maritime/sub sea special warfare units Pilots

title: CEO-Instructor
description: Our creed is based on a high definition integrated competence by the versatility of skills acquired through our training continuously updated through classes in basic and advanced, to meet the most demanding needs of the ever-changing environment. If you as a new bodyguard want to assure yourself some advantages in the competition for the available jobs. The only options you have, are through quality training and education, therefore we have focus on capacity-building, preventive measures and effective protection of client and personal safety during our courses and educations. We teach only the techniques and tactics that we know from our own experience works, which means that our subjects are relevant, realistic, and give you the essential knowledge and abilities of being able to deliver professional close protection. Our commitment is to provide you all the tools you need to succeed in a challenging career with good wage return. The choice is yours ... summary: SERVICE INTELLIGENCE ADVANCED GROUP Staffed by personnel of elite military, security and civil backgrounds.Service Intelligence Advanced Group Officers conduct intelligence operations under tactical and non-tactical conditions in multiple environments; detect, monitor and exploit threat communications through communications transmission intercept and direction finding; and collect positive intelligence information against local terrorists, insurgents, activists, criminal organizations and personnel, and other hostile elements and activities that may pose a threat to United States interests. In addition to their linguistic, international Morse code (IMC), HUMINT and SIGINT skills; we are trained in tactical and field-craft techniques and are certified in advanced military skills. “Certified Fraud Examiner” (CFE), a Certified Security Consultant (CSC) from the International Institute Of Security & Safety Management, IISSM, a “Certified Fraud Consultant” (CFC) from the International Fraud Training Institute a “Fellow” (FACFE) & “Diplomat” (DABFE) of The American College of Forensic Examiners. and certification in “Homeland Security” Level III – CHSIII. Our purpose is to offer governments and other legitimate organizations specialist military expertise an provide active support to friendly governments & to support them in conflict resolution, has materially decreased,s has their capability to do so. Securing strategic assets –water,food,electricity key installations,Convoy escort Air support,Marine support we can assist in non conflict support to law and order, typical areas include, but are not restricted to Counter -narcotics/Counter- terrorism Protection of key installations Revenue/Fisheries protection/maritime surveillance Operations support we can provide specialist in Command,control communication teams Special forces/Maritime/sub sea special warfare units Pilots

title: Witness protection specialist
description: My work experience includes: Project manager, responsible for ensuring that all security projects and programs are properly planned, managed, resourced and governed and that all necessary project controls and standards are in place, enabling timely delivery and completion of the project within budget and specification. Conducting security risk and threat assessments, crime reduction surveys and advising stockholders on the most appropriate methods to protect the organization. Providing specific crime prevention design advice at the planning stage of a building project and ensuring that the appropriate security and all appropriate counter terrorism features are incorporated into the design specifications. Prevention and detection of security breaches and incidents and the creation of a pro security culture. Investigating all instances of violence towards staff, working with the Police and the Crown Prosecution Service and taking the most appropriate action through either the criminal justice process or the civil courts.

title: Commanding Officer
description: Instructed junior pilots in all facets of large multi-engine aircraft operations to include crew resource management, emergency procedures, and basic Special Response Team skills. Mission Commander - Led, planned, managed, and executed assignments to Asset Protection crew and Securing Strategic Assets: Water, Food, Electricity and Key Installations at the highest levels of readiness. Squadron Scheduler - Scheduled daily flight operations in order to meet the individual training requirements of ten independently deployed crews consisting of 196 aircrew personnel. Program Manager - Managed and analyzed data that tracked and correlated Counter Narcotic hours expended as related to each individual's qualifications. Reported the efficiency of squadron Command, Control, Communication, and Intelligence Teams hours utilized to accomplish training objectives and identified inefficiencies in Tactical Field training as well as expired qualifications. Implementation of program allowed squadron to achieve the highest readiness levels at a reduced cost in Training hours. Training Officer - Developed and implemented monthly training plans for continuing professional education of all Special Forces Unit assigned

title: CEO & General Manager
description: Managed daily operations of a $1 million foam insulation company. Developed an effective Strategic, Operational and Tactical Planning. Implemented Operational Research Analysis more Project Estimate accurate bids. Allowed for the tracking of individual job costs and provided feedback as to efficiency of crews with regards to material waste and labor hours. Trained and supervised work crews in more efficient product installation techniques that have reduced material waste by 20% and labor hours by 43%. Developed Private Security Contractor team's knowledge in the areas of building Security Operations and Tactical Security conservation in order to provide customers with the Personal Security to successfully plan for their Assets Protection.

summary: SERVICE INTELLIGENCE ADVANCED GROUP Staffed by personnel of elite military, security and civil backgrounds.Service Intelligence Advanced Group Officers conduct intelligence operations under tactical and non-tactical conditions in multiple environments; detect, monitor and exploit threat communications through communications transmission intercept and direction finding; and collect positive intelligence information against local terrorists, insurgents, activists, criminal organizations and personnel, and other hostile elements and activities that may pose a threat to United States interests. In addition to their linguistic, international Morse code (IMC), HUMINT and SIGINT skills; we are trained in tactical and field-craft techniques and are certified in advanced military skills. “Certified Fraud Examiner” (CFE), a Certified Security Consultant (CSC) from the International Institute Of Security & Safety Management, IISSM, a “Certified Fraud Consultant” (CFC) from the International Fraud Training Institute a “Fellow” (FACFE) & “Diplomat” (DABFE) of The American College of Forensic Examiners. and certification in “Homeland Security” Level III – CHSIII. Our purpose is to offer governments and other legitimate organizations specialist military expertise an provide active support to friendly governments & to support them in conflict resolution, has materially decreased,s has their capability to do so. Securing strategic assets –water,food,electricity key installations,Convoy escort Air support,Marine support we can assist in non conflict support to law and order, typical areas include, but are not restricted to Counter -narcotics/Counter- terrorism Protection of key installations Revenue/Fisheries protection/maritime surveillance Operations support we can provide specialist in Command,control communication teams Special forces/Maritime/sub sea special warfare units Pilots

title: Instructor
description: Instructed junior pilots in all facets of large multi-engine aircraft operations to include crew resource management, emergency procedures, and basic Special Response Team skills. Mission Commander - Led, planned, managed, and executed assignments to Asset Protection crew and Securing Strategic Assets: Water, Food, Electricity and Key Installations at the highest levels of readiness. Squadron Scheduler - Scheduled daily flight operations in order to meet the individual training requirements of ten independently deployed crews consisting of 196 aircrew personnel. Program Manager - Managed and analyzed data that tracked and correlated Counter Narcotic hours expended as related to each individual's qualifications. Reported the efficiency of squadron Command, Control, Communication, and Intelligence Teams hours utilized to accomplish training objectives and identified inefficiencies in Tactical Field training as well as expired qualifications. Implementation of program allowed squadron to achieve the highest readiness levels at a reduced cost in Training hours. Training Officer - Developed and implemented monthly training plans for continuing professional education of all Special Forces Unit assigned
